ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class helped me develop the vocabulary and listening practice to more effectively listen to and write about African music while also allowing me to engage in the complicated dimensions of doing this work cross-culturally. It really opened my eyes to some of the conversations and tensions within the field, while also being musically-grounded in a way that not many other classes I've encountered at Yale have been.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
I think the course design - with discussion of critical and scholarly issues loaded to the front and musical transcriptions in the latter half of the semester - was fantastic. It allowed us to engage with methods of analysis and critical issues before we tried analyzing anything ourselves, which made me feel more confident going into that part of the semester. The course readings and listenings were well-grouped and made for coherent transitions from week to week, and I really felt like my knowledge and skills grew cumulatively throughout.

I also really ended up liking the group final project. It was a little daunting and unorganized at first, but Dr. Veal provided the space and tools we needed to complete a project I feel really proud of and is better than anything any one of us could have completed individually.

I think the course could benefit from more concrete assignments from the onset of the semester. I had mostly finished the midterm essay assignment (analyzing a visual piece of art with our musical analytical terms) when Dr. Veal swapped the assigned essay to cover the critical issues of the course instead. He did so with plenty of time, and I was able to finish the assignment, but felt like I had wasted time and effort writing that other essay.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course. It was an accessible and engaging introduction to some African music, and allowed me to develop analytical skills/listening while also thinking critically about cross-cultural context and analysis.
